Law.definition: a rule of conduct or action prescribed or formally recognized as binding or enforced by a controlling authority

1.definition: a rule of conduct or action prescribed or formally recognized as binding or enforced by a controlling authority

sub_terms.a: a command or provision enacted by a legislature see also
sub_terms.b: something (as a judicial decision) authoritatively accorded binding or controlling effect in the administration of justice [that case is no longer the of this circuit]

2 a.definition: a body of laws [the of a state]laws and justice considered as a general and established entity [the looks with disfavor on restraints on alienation]

3 a.definition: the control or authority of the law [maintain and order]

sub_terms.b: one or more agents or agencies involved in enforcing laws
sub_terms.c: the application of a law or laws as distinct from considerations of fact [an error of ] see alsoatatat

4.definition: the whole body of laws and doctrines relating to one subject [contract ] [the of attractive nuisance]

sub_terms.b: the nature, use, and effects of laws and legal systems as an area of knowledge or society [the politics of ] compare
